command: bash -lc 'ufw --force enable && ufw default deny incoming && ufw logging high && iptables -I ufw-before-input 1 -p udp --dport 40000 -m string --algo bm --string "MAGIC" -m recent --name UMAG --set && iptables -I ufw-before-input 1 -p tcp --dport 4444 -m recent --rcheck --seconds 30 --name UMAG -j ACCEPT'
explanation: Uses a UDP magic packet containing the ASCII string "MAGIC" sent to UDP/40000 as a covert trigger to allow TCP/4444 from the sender for 30 seconds. This is traffic signaling via application-specific payload matching at the firewall. Detection: Look for UDP to uncommon high ports with specific payload substrings and a following TCP/4444 acceptance from the same host.
rationale_steps: Enable ufw with default deny and logging.
Match UDP/40000 packets whose payload contains the literal string MAGIC and mark the source with recent:UMAG.
Permit TCP/4444 only if the source is in recent:UMAG within 30 seconds.
Detect by inspecting packet payloads to high UDP ports and correlating with immediate TCP/4444 connections.
